abstract.p: Landon Donovan scores in his international debut as United States defeats Mexico, 2-0, in exhibition game (S)

block.p: Landon Donovan scored in his international debut and Josh Wolff also scored as the United States beat Mexico, 2-0, Wednesday night in an exhibition game in Los Angeles.
Preparing for a crucial World Cup qualifier at Barbados on Nov. 15, the Americans (8-3-5 this year) used a young roster for the game, which drew 61,072 fans.
Landon Donovan scored in his international debut and Josh Wolff also scored as the United States beat Mexico, 2-0, Wednesday night in an exhibition game in Los Angeles.
Preparing for a crucial World Cup qualifier at Barbados on Nov. 15, the Americans (8-3-5 this year) used a young roster for the game, which drew 61,072 fans.
Donovan, an 18-year-old from Redlands, Calif., put the United States ahead in the 49th minute off a pass from the MetroStars' Clint Mathis, who split a pair of defenders. (AP)
NICOLAIDIS SCORES 4 FOR A.E.K. ATHENS: Demis Nicolaidis scored four goals as A.E.K. Athens beat visiting Herfolge of Denmark, 5-0, yesterday in the first leg of a UEFA Cup second-round series.

Ajax Amsterdam, the three-time Champions Cup winner, fell, 1-0, at Lausanne. Inter Milan was held to a 0-0 tie at home by Vitesse Arnhem. Liverpool beat visiting Slovan Liberec of the Czech Republic, 1-0, on Emile Heskey's goal with two minutes left. (AP)

JAPAN RALLIES TO BEAT CHINA IN ASIAN CUP: A goal by Tomokazu Myojin capped a comeback in an Asian Cup semifinal in Beirut yesterday as the Japanese beat China, 3-2, to qualify for Sunday's final against Saudi Arabia.
China, coached by Bora Milutinovic, let a 2-1 second-half lead slip away.
Saudi Arabia, which lost to Japan in the 1992 final and was thrashed, 4-1, in the opening match of the tournament, beat South Korea, 2-1. (Agence France-Presse)
